action.action-desc: Mr. Carney introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to restore National SMART Grants for a certain number of award years.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SMART Grant Reauthorization Act of 2015.
Section 401A of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070a–1) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending the section heading to read as follows: National SMART Grants;

subparagraph.text: by striking this section and all that follows through for the third and inserting this section for the third;
by redesignating subparagraphs (C) through (E) as subparagraphs (A) through (C), respectively;

clause.text: by striking or at the end of subclause (I) and inserting and;
by striking major in and all that follows through the physical and inserting major in the physical; and
by striking or at the end of subclause (I) and inserting and;
by striking major in and all that follows through the physical and inserting major in the physical; and

subparagraph.text: by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively;
in clause (i), as so redesignated, by striking subparagraph (C) or (D) and inserting subparagraph (A) or (B); and
in clause (ii), as so redesignated, by striking (E) and inserting (C);

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (e)(1) to read as follows:

There are authorized to be appropriated, and there are appropriated, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the Department of Education to carry out this section $400,000,000 for fiscal year 2017 and each of the 5 succeeding fiscal years.
by redesignating subsection (g) as subsection (f); and
in subsection (f), as so redesignated, by striking 2010–2011 and inserting 2020–2021.
